website_summaries.verdict: With the lowest pricing on the market, the SanDisk Ultra II is an excellent upgrade for your aging computer.
pros: The SanDisk Ultra II SSD delivers good performance, and its high-capacity versions are currently the most affordable on the market
cons: The drive's 120GB version is comparatively expensive
The three-year warranty is not as long as might be expected

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: I usually but Samsung SSDs pretty religiously. However, lately they have become much more expensive. This SanDisk has worked great so far. I am using this as my only drive with windows 7, an antivirus and 2 games on it. The usage is at 67 GB of 223 GB. As long as you are not downloading a lot of music or trying to download movies on the machine this should be big enough for you to use it as your only drive. If you do download those things buy a cheap Hard Drive to put those things on and this is still a great choice for your OS
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Just had my 3rd failure in a year.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 20 of these drives over the past year and have been pretty happy with the performance. However, I've had three drives fail in the past year. The most recent drive was installed 4 days ago. Multiple computers refuse to recognize it. At this point, I'm going to send the drive back and replace it with a Samsung Evo. I've deployed 100+ of those with zero failures so far. It is worth the $20 to not have to reinstall the drive and deal with migrating the data.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan B.

customer_reviews.title: Re-awakened a dead laptop...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a drive in a 2010 MacBook Pro (15") which had ceased to function. It certainly gave that laptop new life. I reserve this startup drive for the OS and for non-permanent files. All of my docs and media are stored in external drives so that if I need to replace the OS or wipe the internal drive my tons of data do not disappear. If you take that approach 250-ish gig internally is all you need. Right now after OS installed I've got about 195 Gb available. That's plenty for my daily needs. If I file is worth keeping, it's worth putting in an external drive which mirrors the cloud.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bevan

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these units years ago (two in 2014 and one in 2015). One of these units had near-zero operational time on it. The failure rate is concerning. They don't just fail catastrophically as hard drives typically do, rather they just perform more and more poorly until they are useless. I cannot speak for more recently designed and manufactured units, but I consider myself notified and skeptical! I am now replacing all older SSD units with mechanical, spinning drives. A giant leap backward for mankind!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Glassel

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for computers with mechanical drives
customer_reviews.text: I bought this SSD as an upgrade for a Mid-2011 21.5" iMac. The drive fits perfectly behind the built-in optical drive, and will fit any standard 2.5" laptop drive bay, or larger. It does not come with additional SATA data or power cables, so be sure to buy some of those as well if you don't have extras handy. The drive makes a huge difference when switching from a mechanical hard drive. Even though it is not the fastest SSD available, it is very good for the price and will make a noticeable difference.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton M.

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three. Since installation, flaky operation of Windows and Ubuntu. 3 devices installed, one desktop and 2 different laptops (Gateway and Dell). Unexplained stoppages, freezes, not functioning well. Passes hard drive tests, but does not seem be functioning as reliably as normal hard drives. Freezes require restart. I regret the switch, and am not looking forward to go back to the regular drives but the frustration level with non-functioning devices makes me think I have made a big mistake. I have not had same issues with Crucial SSDs.
customer_reviews.author: Well-read

customer_reviews.title: Fast and quiet, but died too young!
customer_reviews.text: I was moderately happy with my Sandisk Ultra II 240 GB SSD purchased in November 2015 until May 2018, when the disk suddenly died and without any warning sign. I have my data covered but it's still a non minor annoyance when a boot drive dies on you. Did not last 3 full years. Needless to say I am a little suspicious about Sandisk products now. After all, they still brag about the quality and durability of this drive. I liked the speed, the quiet and its small heat emission but didn't last long and is dead like a door nail now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'll never buy a SanDisk product again!
customer_reviews.text: Bought six of these about three years ago. Warranty is good for five years. I had two of the six fail simultaneously, and over the span of another month, the other four failed. The worst part of this is their RMA process sucks! I have never had this bad of an experience trying to get a company to replace an item while it is under warranty! I will NEVER buy another SanDisk product. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: IT Guru

customer_reviews.title: Will not last. Will die on you and can't retrieve data
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Defeats the purpose of SSD. why would anyone wanna buy it if it randomly dies on you? No warning sign or anything. After 3 years it just died. You can even retrieve data. Sure you they will send you a new one through RMA. But, what about your data? Smh. Better off with traditional HDD. at least you can retrieve data afterwards. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Nishant Shah

customer_reviews.title: Lightning Fast!
customer_reviews.text: It's as straightforward to install as any SATA drive, which really depends on your system. MAN does it speed things up! My boot speed on my ASUS with an HQ, quad-core i7 was about 35sec, and once I installed this, it went down to below 10. Amazing. General operation and program loading also became lightning fast. This thing really unlocked the potential of my system, which was clearly being held back by my old 5700rpm HDD.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: Super cheap, super performance, simply amazing. Swapping to an SSD is the single largest performance boost most users can get on their computer. Prices have halved in the year since I've bought this but the drive has worked perfectly! You might want to buy the larger SSD, though. 20 or 30 bucks extra for double or quadruple the space goes a long way. I wish I had a 256 GB right now because I'm spoiled from the fast speeds and just put everything on my SSD now. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: M W

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. Could not get ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Could not get the cloned SSD drive to be recognized by HP Probook 450G3. When I tried to repeat the process the third party software that SanDisk sends you to, said "sorry software is for single use - please buy the software". I have purchased and used 3 Samsung SSDs without any issues and they provide the cloning software - works the first time without issues. I could spend a bunch of time reading FAQ and emailing and I am sure at some point there would be resolution. Although SanDisk is now part of Western Digital the Western Digital version of Acronis clone software does not work with the SanDisk SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Kartanos

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I've always had good luck with SanDisk products, and this SSD did not disappoint. It appears to be nicely made and provides extremely fast performance compared to a spinning HDD. The downloadable SanDisk utility software is fairly useless. If you're planning to replace a HDD with an SSD, there are many good and free disk cloning programs available which will format, partition, and copy. But SanDisk does not offer one, or at least did not at the time I purchased this drive. Honestly, I have forgotten the differences between the SanDisk SSD product lines, but for all but the most demanding installations, I don't think you can go wrong with the Ultra II line.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: SSDs are good I hope by now everyone upgraded to SSD
customer_reviews.text: Solid hard drive. SSDs are good I hope by now everyone upgraded to SSD. A lot of people are trying to buy fastest SSD out there, but you guys have to check your mother board transfer speed. Older computers can only transfer 250 mb/s newer ones 500 mb/s and I am not sure about latest computers.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey P

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a fair/good price
customer_reviews.text: Have been using the drive in an external enclosure at a NAS...it have been working good and the access/response time is good. When I first installed the drive into the enclosure and connected it to my laptop, the needed driver downloaded in Windows 7 but it was visible in the explorer window when opening the "Computer" window. I looked on the Internet and found instructions on how to use the "Manage" utility to make it visible as a drive with a letter assigned to it. Specific details/steps can be found on the Internet to get it to show in the explorer window as a drive with a letter assigned.
customer_reviews.author: My Product Review

customer_reviews.title: Night and Day performance difference.
customer_reviews.text: We have a four year old Dell laptop with a 3rd gen I7 processor and 8 Gig of ram running Windows 10. We installed this SSD and it gave that laptop speed that we never thought possible. With the new performance, we won't be buying a new laptop for a while. If your sitting on the fence about purchasing one of these drives? Do it, you won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic SSD. Replaced a 5400 spinning drive with this ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic SSD. Replaced a 5400 spinning drive with this and boot up is unbelievable. I mostly just let my laptop hibernate (close the lid) and it was driving me crazy to have to wait 5 minutes before I could use it when I opened it back up. Now it is ready literally in 3-5 seconds. No slowdowns. I wish I had done this two years ago. I also bought the Appricorn upgrade kit to transfer my old drive's OS and data over to the SSD so from start to finish the upgrade took 15 minutes including copying everything over and swapping the drives. I was going to waste $1,500 on a new laptop with an SSD so I saved $1,400!
customer_reviews.author: GAMtnGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my pair of SanDisk SSD's, as so, they work perfectly with no issues. I haven't done any ridiculous speed testing, but files read/write fast enough with no noticeable lags or hiccups. They surprised me with the weight, they weigh absolutely nothing in comparison to my older Patriot and Intel drives which have aluminum cases. Its both a pro and a con that the cases are made out of a cheap plastic material, but i don't plan on using these in the field so durability is not a huge concern. HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Great price.
customer_reviews.author: MaysEffect

customer_reviews.title: Fast drive, quick ship, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Very fast drive, comes with drive health software. Makes booting and general desktop use much faster, the slowest thing on computers was the mechanical drive for so many years now, at this point there is no reason not to get one of these. Don't fixate on the gee wiz high sequencial transfer rates drives advertise, most drive access in windows is small random reads and writes. Even older computers will feel like new if you install one of these, even those limited by sata 3gbps for that very reason.
customer_reviews.author: Vermecilli

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Installed into a new build as a boot drive, and has worked without any issues out of the box. I have not benchmarked its read/write speeds, but so far I'm not having issues with it, time-wise. Windows 8.1 boots in less than 10 seconds, and can go through an entire reboot in about 30. Load times for games I put on the SSD are much lower - for Battlefield 4, for instance, I can load a map in about 30 seconds, whereas if it was installed on an HDD, it would take about 2 minutes. If anything happens to the drive, I will update this review, but it is likely that I will have purchased a new SSD by then.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Very good SSD for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very good SSD for the price. (I got it on sale for $99) It replaced a WD VelociRaptor WD1600HLHX 160GB 10K RPM hard drive. I noticed the difference right away. I did a clean install of windows 7 ultimate instead of cloning the old drive data over to the SSD. Windows installed from a USB drive in less than 7 minutes, and now my desktop boots up in less than 20 seconds. This is my windows/programs drive now, and everything launches MUCH faster, and I even noticed in game quickness compared to the old drive. If you are looking for an upgrade for your desktop or laptop, don't hesitate to pick up this drive.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my original hard drive in my 2009 15" macbook pro. It works flawlessly. Originally my computer would take 5 min to boot up, it was so slow I just wouldn't shut it down and now with this new SSD installed it takes maybe 1 minute or less. Applications also run multiple times faster and the only thing I upgraded was the hard drive. Installation was also super easy, took me less then 30 minutes to take the old one out and put the new one in and Im not even a computer savvy person.
customer_reviews.author: Bowen Wang

customer_reviews.title: Good performance and reliability
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product two times actually. The first one that I received became defective within the first few weeks. I couldn't get anything to load on it, luckily with the help of Amazon customer service and Sandisk customer service, they sent me a replacement and it's been holding up for four months now! Speeds are very consistent. Boot times are incredible, like 10-15 seconds and you're in! The SSD itself actually looks pretty nice. Installing it is breeze. The thing I don't like is that the price for this and for SSDs in general are pretty high, but you get what you pay for and this was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Adolfo

customer_reviews.title: I can feel the wind in my hair!
customer_reviews.text: Whoo-eee does this baby fly! The IT pro at work told me that installing an SSD is the best performance upgrade value you can choose and he was right. I migrated my OS to this disk from a platter-type hard drive. Now I get a boot-up of Windows 7 in under thirty seconds. My applications are responding much more quickly too. Kind of like putting a V-8 in a Honda Civic -hang on!.
customer_reviews.author: Restoration Hobbyist

customer_reviews.title: Good drive but there are better options
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work as described. I am in the process of cloning my old hard drive and using this. Will follow up after I can do some testing. The drive does seem pretty fast initially. 1/19/16 - Updated review, not as fast as originally thought. If I had been smart I would've spent a little more money and picked up the Samsung drive which far outperforms this one. Not bad but it is not as fast as SanDisk says it is.
customer_reviews.author: Todd D.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quiet Efficient drive
customer_reviews.text: Used as an external USB storage drive. Quick & efficient but I should have bought a larger GB size for what I am using it for. It is easy to mount externally or internally. Good drive, light weight, temperature friendly if used as an internal. (Doesn't add to the internal of enclosed CPU heat) With SSD drives becoming more and more popular I am sure the prices will drop eventually.
customer_reviews.author: DanoTop Contributor: Bob Dylan

customer_reviews.title: A HUGE improvement over the OEM hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a HDD in my Lenovo B560 laptop. Using Macrium Reflect Free, I cloned my larger HDD, adjusted and removed OEM partitions, and then installed the SDD. It worked immediately and seamlessly. This is SO much faster than the HDD, and doesn't generate any heat. A great update that improves speed tremendously, particularly at initial startup!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mustang Sally

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: died the day before finals, Purchased March 2016, dead June 2017. Takes over a month to replace, if they replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and super fast! I would recommend this upgrade for anyone ...
customer_reviews.text: I got the 240gb version when it was on sale for $80! It's inexpensive and super fast! I would recommend this upgrade for anyone still using regular HDDs for their OS. This will cut your boot times in half at least! Don't forget to set up the drive in AHCI mode for optimal performance! As a side note, I didn't know this at the time of purchase, but the 480gb version is apparently made differently to achieve higher performance. I can attest to that statement since my buddy purchased the 480 gb version when I purchased the 240gb and his Windows rating for the hard drive is .1 higher than mine! ><
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My 2012 mbp feels like a new laptop. Very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Boyd Cole

customer_reviews.title: Computer speed much better
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the old hard drive in a dell desktop for a friend. You’ll notice that the speed of the computer will be much better than with the previous hard drive. The price is what really got me to order this product as well as San disk reputation.
customer_reviews.author: John and Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Easily saved me over a thousand dollars
customer_reviews.text: I have a eight year old desktop that I use as a media server in my front room. It was very slow to boot up on Windows 7 and I was on the verge of replacing it with a new $1,200 machine. Instead I bought this drive, installed Windows 8.1 and presto, I have a very fast booting machine that can easily handle all the media and internet usage we throw at it. I use the legacy drives for long term media storage and this one for short term download watch and delete type videos. Love it, Love it, Love it!
customer_reviews.author: D. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Very nice results with conversion from HD to SSD on Sony Laptop
customer_reviews.text: One of the easiest things I've ever done to upgrade a laptop (a working laptop). All you need is: 1) A sata to usb cable. I used the one from Startech sold on Amazon for 12 bucks 2) A Sandisk SSD. (I used the SanDisk Ultra II 240GB SATA III 2.5inch 7mm) 3) The computer you are upgrading (I have a Sony Vaio Win 7 Pro) The software is downloadable from  It worked great. Done in lees than 15 minutes and runs great
customer_reviews.author: jschaube

customer_reviews.title: oh, well!
customer_reviews.text: works. should have waited for SSD Plus, which is newer and faster transfer rate 121317-I am disappointed that this product has reduced $14+ in less than 60 days, more so, in past one week. I wrote an inquiry about this Ultra vs@ $78+. the newer SSD @ $74+ and received no response.
customer_reviews.author: E. V. Wong

customer_reviews.title: it works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is working just the way that I wanted it to. I switched from a traditional hard drive to this SSD. After I installed it in my laptop, and reinstalled the OS, it works like a dream. Start up time, after having it installed for 2-3 months now, still remains at about 15-20 seconds compared to the 2-3 minutes it used to take. Full hard drive virus scanning and indexing are just a few minutes and seconds respectively. I'm planning on getting another one for my other laptop soon. The battery life on my laptop has improved, not by much, but has improved. This hard drive does the job for me.
customer_reviews.author: Luke N.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Put this in a 2011 MacBook Pro, and wow. Computer is now humming! I've worked with Photoshop documents over 1GB and had good success (only issues have been on Adobe's end.) Start up and restart times drastically improved (duh.) To transfer, I used a USB to SATA connector, copied my HDD to SSD, then simply swapped out the drives. I did this all without any third-party software. Note: you will need some small philips head screwdrivers to swap the drives. I have not had any TRIM issues. Will update if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: The Few and the Proud

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a rock and just as quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Had a notebook with a dying hard drive. It's all the excuse I needed to try a solid-state drive. I've used Sandisk thumb drives for years and find them to be reliable so . . . Installation was simple. It drops right in. The only things different from the original drive are speed, and noise. These pups are fast, and silent. I highly recommend this drive for your next upgrade of replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Dhammic Companion

customer_reviews.title: I buy these drives for the company I work with ...
customer_reviews.text: I buy these drives for the company I work with. Instead of buying a new computer I use one of these drives and brings back to live computers that are 5 years old or more. Definitely worth it. Completely reliable and have purchased more than 20 of these over the last 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Initial thoughts are positive.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to increase the storage in my PC because 120GB wasn't cutting it anymore. Pros 1. It's fast like an SSD should be. The fastest? Nope, but it's not that huge of a difference. 2. Didn't come DOA. 3. BIOS saw it on the first try. Windows installed quickly. 4. Windows boots quickly. Apps open quickly. 5. The utility to gauge the health is pretty nifty. Cons 1. None yet. If anything goes wrong I'll report back but otherwise I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. F. Hindy

customer_reviews.title: Only the $$ per GB is a negative
customer_reviews.text: I can't attest to some of the important stuff like longevity. But I am giving this 5 stars anyway. This is my first SSD, and I will never buy a HDD again. No heat. No whir. One fifth the size/volume. I bought this for a HTPC build and it has met all my desires there. The icing was boot times. I am getting Restarts of Win7 that take under 25 seconds. Write times seem to be similarly improved.
customer_reviews.author: odis dunkle

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great SSD. Installed it on my laptop, no hassle there. So much faster than the old HDD that came with my laptop which is a few years old. It boots up so much faster, games and programs run noticeably faster also. Shipping was fast, to Canada too. Had an Amazon gift card that I could only use on .com, which is the reason I ordered from here. All in all, two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Not WOW effect.
customer_reviews.text: This one went into Asus N56VJ to replace the factory hard drive. I did a fresh Windows install. The laptop has 16GB of RAM and the mechanical drive is still in use, replacing the DVD drive in a caddy. Overall performance is great. Laptop keeps temp between 40 and 50 degrees (measured with Aida 64). This laptop is used to run VMs, different simulators and daily operations.
customer_reviews.author: TitoValchev

customer_reviews.title: What a hard disc to beet... ! This is an ULTRA SSD..!
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit .. put it in a Zotac Mini PC... performs like a dream... I'm not one to do Benchmarking for SSDs... I could care less about millisecond differences between SSds... I do know this is a conventional HDD killer... It works well... does what I need it to do... and it does it nicely.. system boots in about 10-12 seconds... I highly recommend this SSD... If I need another SSD in the future... A Sandisk Ultra SSD is on my short list...
customer_reviews.author: Edward Pendleton

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable SSD
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to use this drive for just under a year. I originally received it in June 2016. It failed in August 2016, no longer being recognized by my computer. I RMA'd it to Sandisk, who replaced or repaired it and returned it to me. It has now failed again as of April 2017. I cannot recommend this product when it has failed twice within the span of one year.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Longstreet

customer_reviews.title: Great performance on Sata II, i'm amazed on how the disk improved my laptop
customer_reviews.text: I order the SSD and the shipping was fastest than i expected. I wanted to keep my old laptop for another 4 years at least and i order this disk, and more ram. I attached a picture of how it improved my computer (I'm running Sata II so it proves the disk its fully backwards compatible from Sata III). It came with the adaptor for 3.5'' and an URL to download Sandisk software, how to install it and it worked perfectly, no firmware update needed as it is the newest software, good for Amazon for this.
customer_reviews.author: tiko.col

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing how big a difference this thing makes
customer_reviews.text: If you don't already have an SSD - get one. This thing is FAST. Computer starts in less than 7 seconds, programs open immediately. Virus scans take almost half the time to run. It's amazing how big a difference this thing makes. And you'll never realize how much noise your old HDD made until you swap it out with one of these. Now if they could just invent inexpensive silent pc fans....
customer_reviews.author: Scoop

customer_reviews.title: life changing !!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, good instructions. Slipped it in the laptop for a quick upgrade. Note: i had to use a cloning software and hd to usb cord to transfer my windows to ssd. My computer feels like new, i love this. i cant believe i didnt do this earlier.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for a slow computer
customer_reviews.text: Other than more RAM, there's no better upgrade you can make for your computer. Make the switch from hard drive to SSD with this puppy and you'll see how great your old computer feels. I've had no issue with this item -- in fact, I've bought 3 of them at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Yabby

customer_reviews.title: Breath new life into your computer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old style hard drive in a tough book laptop. I can not believe how much faster it boots up and runs. I bought the Apricorn kit to transfer the old hard drive to the new one. The transfer went fairly easy but ran into one problem the Windows key did not transfer so if you install a new SSD hard drive be sure you have the Key written down. The system works flawlessly make the old machine run like new?
customer_reviews.author: T. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good mid-range SSD
customer_reviews.text: It's been a month of use and so far so good. I replaced a 1tb 5400rpm HDD in my laptop with this, so the performance increase was phenomenal. My main reason for getting this one was I didn't need a top of the line ssd since I knew any one would blow my old hdd out of the water. This is Sandisks mid range ssd at the moment, and compared to the sketchy quality control of some other slightly cheaper brands out there, this one holds good value. Edit: Still going strong in September 2018, with SMART protocol reading 97% life left. I have clean installed Windows more than once in it and have just switched to Ubunutu as well.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from HDD, fast read/write, produces less heats. Faster computing for anyone.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade from a failing HDD, and I'm glad I did, my computer seems so much faster and produces a lot less heat thanks to the fact this has no moving parts. While a bit of an expensive upgrade it's well worth it in the long run, I can access data so much faster and my game loading times are much shorter with this.
customer_reviews.author: Delebird

customer_reviews.title: It definitely increased my computer's speed! I have a ...
customer_reviews.text: It definitely increased my computer's speed! I have a macbook pro early 2011 and it works very well. It's a 3-and-a-half year old computer but with this ssd I feel I can use it two more years (I was thinking about getting a new one after half a year or a year). It doesn't support trim. I don't know if this matters much, I just saw many people talking about using trim on ssd.
customer_reviews.author: wendy

customer_reviews.title: Works great - great value
customer_reviews.text: Put this SSD in my Lenovo Thinkpad T430s just today. I had to purchase an SATA III to USB 3.0 to copy my OS from my HDD to this, and it was a breeze. Boot time is insane, and apps load faster. I mean... it's an SSD, so, yeah. It's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Michael Bush

customer_reviews.title: Great customer support!
customer_reviews.text: While I enjoyed this SSD, it died after a year. I called up SanDisk and had no problem with the warrantly. They sent me a new SSD and I was back to using it again. Excellent customer support, will continue to buy from SanDIsk.
customer_reviews.author: VictorWTorres

customer_reviews.title: SSD Upgrade Is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: A new SSD is the ultimate computer upgrade! I replaced my 7 year old SATA drive for the Sandisk Ultra II. My computer was very sluggish and would take at least 3 to 5 minutes for a full boot up. After cloning the hard drive I installed the new SSD and it booted in under 30 seconds!! Amazing! This thing runs faster than it did when it was brand new!! Best money I have ever spent. If your computer is running slow as most do after 5 years, this is the most economical upgrade you can do.
customer_reviews.author: R. Morton

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: I know that there are faster drives out there, but my Windows 10 and my Linux both boot in 10 seconds. At that point, who cares? Great drive.
customer_reviews.author: Daring Dewback

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price and performance improvemt you get
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome change in my systems performance. Boot up time and shutdown time are a breeze now- I do a lot of work in Photoshop and Illustrator - I used to be sooooo scared to shutdown my system, was about 5 - 10 mins to get my system up to a useable state. Now it's seconds...unbelievable. What's more impressive is the way my applications respond fluidly now. Processes work much faster now. The only con I have are the plastic parts in this drive, still a good buy for the price and performance though.
customer_reviews.author: Temitope

customer_reviews.title: Solid drive!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my MacBook and it has made a world of difference. I had a failing hard drive and took it to a repair shop who couldn't fix it. I did research and gave it a shot myself and it worked like a charm. thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Shmily

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this SSD to replace OEM HD in order to speed up my wife's laptop. Indeed, this dramatically improved the user experience. The WIN7 boot time decreased by an order of magnitude as well as an exit from suspend state. I have it already about a year without any problem so far.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Zaidman

customer_reviews.title: Nice SSD drive
customer_reviews.text: Cloned hard drive with the Free Macrium Reflect software. Install this drive as the main drive. Big improvement in all areas including boot time and access time. The downloaded Sandisk SSD Dashboard application is useful.
customer_reviews.author: ATech

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. But didn't fix windows 10 slow boot issue (not it's fault) good quality and nice that it came with a spacer so you can replace an older laptop hdd
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade MacBook Pro Mid 2009
customer_reviews.text: What a major difference it made on my Macbook Pro Mid 2009. The old hard drive had completely failed, and I decided to purchase this one and fix the laptop instead of buying a new one. I had the original Os X 10.6 disk, that came with my laptop, and once the drive was installed, all I had to do is format the new drive and install the OS, and all the upgrades. Laptop now is working fast, like a new machine. Worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: failed after 3.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: This drive as a 3 year guarantee (warranty) on it. I bought it in 2014 and it is now 2018 (180 over warranty) and it has failed. Sandisk is not worth wasting money on.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew N.

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 48 hours.
customer_reviews.text: This product is garbage. The drive lasted two days before it failed without warning and was no longer recognized by the system BIOS. Highly recommend sticking with Intel or other reputable manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: I replace a lot of drives. This is my preferred SSD for normal use. Tough but great value and speed!
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Hoagberg

customer_reviews.title: quick and has been working great for than a few years
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of the laptop mechanical type hard drive. This saves battery life, is silent, quick and has been working great for than a few years.
customer_reviews.author: K_L

customer_reviews.title: it is works just fine. I should spend a little more for Samsung ...
customer_reviews.text: it is works just fine. I should spend a little more for Samsung 850. this drive is slower than my old samsung ssd 830 evo. Window 7 performance rate this drive is the slower components in my PC. just get what you are paid for.
customer_reviews.author: AvgBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and plenty for space for my server
customer_reviews.text: Works great and plenty for space for my server. I was using a hardware mirror with a couple SATA300 disks. Transfers to my RAID 5 array were dropping to less than 40MB/s. After installing this transfers went back up to 100MB/s. I thought my raid 5 array was the culprit but turns out it was the aging mirror. I was able to image from the mirror over to the SSD using acronis without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Kauspedas

customer_reviews.title: Fast boot, data secured
customer_reviews.text: Super fast boot Easy to install No moving parts- no mechanical failure If your tired of your SATA drives failing, loosing data and time to recover data, then upgrade your drives to SSD
customer_reviews.author: ALGOS

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend this: )
customer_reviews.text: A must needed upgrade for my PC. packaging is very simple and doesnt come with anything else other than the drive itself. You might want to do some research on a cloning software if you're going to replace your bootdrive with this. I had a time finding a decent software coz most softwares dont do the necessary changes at the BIOS or whatnot level [i.e to replace the current C drive after cloning the drive] Apart from that, no issues at all with this drive. Boot time of my PC came down to less than 10 seconds from 30 or so seconds. Apps load up instantly and everything. Totally recommend this :)
customer_reviews.author: Lalinda P.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great - computer is much faster
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace an HD to improve speed. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Easy upgrade
customer_reviews.text: We bought an HTC Vive and I wanted a fresh Windows 10 install on a new drive to run it on. This worked great. I will never go back to a traditional drive. SSD's are the way to go. I don't know how this compares speed-wise to a samsung EVO series, but for the money it is a quick and easy upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: zacware

customer_reviews.title: Get the 240 not the 120
customer_reviews.text: Had the 120 GB Sandisk. Worked great, but for a few dollars more got this 240 GB. You will love SSD drives. Don't experiment and buy low capacity. Get as big of capacity as you can afford. Moved the 120 GB to my 10 year old Asus netbook and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: Helped bring a 2010 Macbook Pro back to life
customer_reviews.text: Helped bring a 2010 Macbook Pro back to life. I replaced the hard drive with this, added 8GB of RAM, New battery, and now it runs High Sierra with no problems
customer_reviews.author: A-Tech

customer_reviews.title: No problems after 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: Four months later, no problems. Allows WinXP on this netbook to boot up in half the time as platters and eliminates the mechanical commotion. Another year while the prices drop on the larger sizes and the rest of my machines will get converted.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Robison

customer_reviews.title: Easy does it
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Easy to set up once I figured out what I was doing, as this was my first time at cloning my hard drive. It has given new speed to my old computer, boot up time I'd now 30 seconds, use to take a minute and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Athallus

customer_reviews.title: Yup, magic memory makers
customer_reviews.text: As usual SanDisk makes magic ram more magical than most magicians of magical ram. I cloned a windows 7 install from an original Lenovo Z575 - 5400 rpm drive to this drive and the little AMD A8 laptop became fast stealthy and dangerous. Oh yeah and it boots in seconds not minutes - to a usable desktop. Firefox actually opens in a couple of seconds even with all the garbage on.
customer_reviews.author: By_Rant_Or_Ruin - truth.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: It is nice to have this SSD at this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: had to format w/firewire /in target disc mode and load OS from another mac but works like a charm will get another one for other mac
customer_reviews.text: fit right into my macbook pro perfectly, had to format w/firewire /in target disc mode and load OS from another mac but works like a charm will get another one for other mac laptop
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: will OWN your HDD
customer_reviews.text: Best upgrade for the money. Super-fast load times and transfers. I have always trusted SanDisk products going way way back, and this drive has been easy to use, and performs as advertised. Installed for nearly a month as my OS drive. I got it on sale, and if I remember right it was substantially cheaper than the competition.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: this SanDisk works just as well if not better. So if you getting it for an older ...
customer_reviews.text: Using this on a motherboard with SATA 2, so this might not be relevant to people with newer motherboard that support full SATA 3 speed: I replaced a Hyper-X Kingston SSD of 120GB with this, and even though the Kingston was supposed to be high tier, this SanDisk works just as well if not better. So if you getting it for an older computer like I did, it's perfect. Don't waste money on more expensive ones if you using SATA 2.
customer_reviews.author: Idan

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably FAST!!
customer_reviews.text: Super fast. So easy to install. And I've only opened my PC case twice, ever. I replaced my old 320gb Hard Drive, in my old HP, and this little ball of fire has made my Windows 98 and dial up seem so fast. Web pages open BEFORE I click them. It's that FAST!!! I will buy 2 more for my other PC's very soon. Did I say it's FAST?
customer_reviews.author: JayW

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for $85 on black Friday, wanted it to replace a crappy Kingston V300 that does not even deliver half its advertised performance. Performance of this SanDisk SSD is excellent! It trades blows with a 840Evo I own, but the Samsung cost me like twice. Best $85 I've spent in my life.
customer_reviews.author: G. Belli

customer_reviews.title: A very good product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it from Amazon. Long time no use. Recently the samsung SSD (128GB) on my PC seems to small so transferred the operating system (Windows) to this one. Works fine, do not see any problem. Installation is easy. Update: Still works great after one year.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD + Crappy netbook = Meh netbook.
customer_reviews.text: I am using it in a netbook and it improved the netbook usability until it was almost as good as a normal laptop's. It has near instant turning on/off with Windows 10 but it doesn't fix the problem of the netbook being a netbook which means the rest of the system is pretty crappy. But since I no longer have to wait three minutes for this thing to turn on then I am more than satisfied with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Finn

customer_reviews.title: I seriously can't go back to using my macbook after ...
customer_reviews.text: I seriously can't go back to using my macbook after using an SSD. So freaking slow its unbearable. 10-11 second boot time for Windows 8.1. Everything opens lightning fast. If you don't have the money for the 240gb, at least go for the 120gb and just only use it for the OS and applications you constantly use. Serious time saver. But be warned, you will not be able to go back to a standard HD.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: This SanDisk has been great so far
customer_reviews.text: So my third Samsung SDD has died on three different systems. I thought they would be reliable but I'm just not lucky. This SanDisk has been great so far. Fast and reliable as my kids OS drive.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan H

customer_reviews.title: Jury still out
customer_reviews.text: Can’t get it to work but I think I bought the wrong one for my computer.
customer_reviews.author: drthunderpuss

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. I lost months of work because of this
customer_reviews.text: Long overdue, the HD failed after 4 months of purchase. No luck in making contact with the seller to make them aware. I spent over $100 on this. Very disappointed. I lost months of work because of this. I never had an issue with Sandisk with their portable flash drives. still upset. Lost my money and data.
customer_reviews.author: Bry

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I am *SO HAPPY* with this drive. The HD on my 3 year old laptop crapped out and I bought this to replace it. Boot and wake-up times have gone from minutes to seconds. If you are thinking about replacing a slow laptop, think about one of these instead. A hundred bucks might save you the price of a new laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnett

customer_reviews.title: excellent Black Friday deal
customer_reviews.text: Great SSD especially for the price I got it on sale for $85 around black friday. installed in my computer with no problem. once installed and formated the drive shows as having 223 GB available. set up is very easy. the Drive does not come with any cables or screws so you would need to supply these yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: I got this to use as a boot drive in ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use as a boot drive in my mac mini. I got the dual drive kit from ifixit and away we went. Simply imaged the SSD from the factory HDD, installed the dual drive kit, set it to boot from the SSD and we were up and running. Loving this setup, and the drive has not given me any issues thus far.
customer_reviews.author: MarkoPolo

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great drive. Sped my system up immensely
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great drive. Sped my system up immensely. It was a bit tricky to install since it comes uninitialized, meaning you'll need to set it up outside of windows or using special software. However once I got it working, everything's been a breeze. I boot to desktop on windows 8.1 in under 10 seconds now, and programs open instantly.
customer_reviews.author: SteelerfaninPeru

customer_reviews.title: Installation and cloning of my system's O/S went very easy and smoothly
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these drives. One for my desktop and one for my laptop. I also bought a 6-Gb/s SATA-3 PCIe card for my desktop to take advantage of the Sandisk's SSD speed. Installation and cloning of my system's O/S went very easy and smoothly. I have since upgraded my O/S to Windows-10 with no problem. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: RDNS

customer_reviews.title: I Recieved a Dead Product
customer_reviews.text: I installed this hard drive into 3 different computers but none the computers could detect the SSD, I change the settings in bios, unsuccessful. I will not be purchasing this product again
customer_reviews.author: Flipphead

customer_reviews.title: PS3 Hard Drive Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Cyber Monday for a great price. I used it in my ps3 to get faster saving/loading. It is noticibly faster. This is one of the few ways that an end user can get more out of a PS3.
customer_reviews.author: freak3dot

customer_reviews.title: Failed within one year
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of San Disk, but this HD died after only a few months of use. I am hoping they honor the warranty but now I have to rip my computer apart again to deal with replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Arzberger

customer_reviews.title: I told all my friends to install SSD
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my c: drive (320GB) with this SSD. Now it only takes less than 20 seconds to boot up my Windows 7. Every application is so fast. It only takes me 40 minutes to scan virus now versus 4+ hours before. It is also really fast to browse the internet. Now I can shutdown my laptop every time after I use it (No hibernate anymore). It took me about 40+ minutes to clone my c: drive over to SSD (about 65 GB data). It took me 5 minutes to replace my c:drive to SSD. The shipping was from Fort Worth to Dallas (Plano) and is much faster than I expected. I am very happy about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie Dean

customer_reviews.title: Good quality SSD at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. Having used SanDisk products before I was happy to see this SSD at a great price. It was perfect for boosting my Mac mini's performance without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: H.Troy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sweet. I think it feels quite obvious that ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sweet. I think it feels quite obvious that the innards are smaller than the form factor. I assume they could fit the actual contents into something more usb flashdrive size, but they have to keep to the 2.5 standard--you can just tell it's very light and feels empty inside. Fast, quiet, cool, umm...nothing bad to say.
customer_reviews.author: NotMyFirstRodeo

product_meta.title: SanDisk Ultra II 240GB SSD (SDSSDHII-240G) SATA 2.5 (Bulk Packaging)
product_meta.description: Boost your PC’s performance up to 28x with an easy and affordable upgrade to SanDisk Ultra II SSD. You’ll enjoy no-wait boot up, and shorter application load and data transfer times than your traditional hard drive ever delivered—plus longer battery life and much cooler, quieter computing, too. No matter how you use your PC, SanDisk’s nCache 2.0 technology makes for a better experience, delivering high speed and staying power even when you’re socializing, shopping and watching the playoffs all at once. Proven shock and vibration resistance mean you won’t lose your data even if you drop your computer. When you’re ready for a better computing experience without buying a new computer, this easy-to-do-yourself upgrade to SanDisk Ultra II SSD will make your old PC behave like a brand-new machine.
feature_bullets: More than 28x better performance than typical HDD.
Better overall system performance with faster application loads and better response.
SanDisk's nCache 2.0 technology delivers enhanced speed and endurance
NCQ support manages queue length for better multitasking and workload management

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,158 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
